boardgame.name: Cyberstorm 2: Corporate War
boardgame.description:
Sequel to Mission Force: Cyberstorm.

Allows for either real-time or turn-based play.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CyberStorm_2%3A_Corporate_Wars CyberStorm 2: Corporate Wars]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Whose Treasure
boardgame.description:
Whose Treasure is a card game for people to make the time more enjoyable with friends. Players try to make full completed maps as soon as possible in the FIRST MODE match or as many as possible in the FINAL MODE match. Players take turns to put their cards on the table and draw cards from the deck to keep 4 cards in their hands.

Since many maps are almost complete over time, the game becomes more exciting, so players try to prevent others from completing the maps.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Forge at the Frozen End
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

A location, character, and magical items for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition. Battle map and tokens included!

A towering pillar stands at the frozen edge of the world. Enormous chains hold it in place, slowing its inevitable fall into the sea as the ice around it melts. Their origin, and that of the forge within, only one person knows: Stalvus Weissbjorn, the Frozen Forgemaster.

boardgame.name: Greybanner, Part 1: The History and People
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Word of the Greybanner Grand Tournament spread far and wide. A tradition held once a decade, the fighting competition draws the finest independent warriors in the region, as well as opportunists with a skill for craftsmanship, medicine, and gambling. It is an explosion of activity in the small town. But not all are after fame or coin, and the meaning for the tournament lies not within the arena, but deep below. The roar of battle echoes down, rattling the chains of Greybanner’s oldest secret.

Taking a departure from our usual structure, we come to our second full adventure outline. This will focus on introducing a campaign through a focused setting and adventure that even amateur DMs can follow. Unlike our previous adventure through the Banahogg, this will follow the structure of official resources. We will begin in the titular town, with its background and key figures. Future entries will then cover the many locations and possible activities, the primary plot, and its fateful conclusion.

boardgame.name: Greybanner, Part 2: Locations in Town
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Hundreds flock to Greybanner in preparation for the Grand Tournament. Once open streets are quickly populated by stalls and carts, and merchants’ voices begin to fill the air. The outskirts of town see camps and caravans arrive. Hopeful warriors share glances of anticipation as they size up their competition. The residents of the town move with a hurried excitement, tending to the swarms of new patrons and customers. This is the most business they will see for another decade and they will not let it go to waste.

Having covered the town’s history, council, and overview in [part 1], it’s time to dive into the specifics. This section will focus on all the locations players might visit, what they can do there, and who they might meet. Each one is easy to follow and plan for, with descriptions that you can read directly to players. Our goal is to make using them as simple as possible. You can drop them into your game world without having to worry about finicky, stressful planning.

boardgame.name: Greybanner, Part 3: The Greybanner Region
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Greybanner has many buildings and businesses of note for travelers. It is a town of activity and interest. But there is much more in the surrounding region. Roads cut through the thick, brambled forest to find mines and the Lumberyard, while others cross the rocky hills of the western plains. Each path presents its own risks. The cover of rocks and cliffs make for easy road-side ambushes, and giants and kobolds move above and below the mountains, respectively. Even the southern forest is sick with a blight that plagues its wildlife. A new danger and a new adventure awaits in every direction.

We’ve already covered everything in Greybanner, so now it’s time for everything around it. There are a number of locations that might draw your players’ attention and its important to know what is in each and what they might find along the way. Each one should prove unique from the last, for a new experience every session. You can run your own adventures or use ours (coming soon!), which will cover exactly what players will uncover in each location.

boardgame.name: Greybanner Coliseum: Arena Traps and Hazards
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

The Arena’s fighting pit has seen innumerable magical and engineered upgrades over its lifetime. The enchanted mechanisms in its walls and beneath the sand allow the Arena Master and his men to quickly, drastically alter the environment between rounds. These alterations begin with walls and inclines before other, more intricate mechanisms are attached. Some have the ability to spit fire, launch poisoned darts, or to trigger when a fighter strays too close. The randomness and unknowable dangers to every fight is one the Arena’s key draws, with audiences often cheering for or betting on the use of these traps to end a fight.

Erwin Redmane oversees the traps with the utmost detail and care. He does so with the assistance of both Eva Cinderbrow and Elias Gilderoy. The former has had a personal hand in advancing both the variety and functions of the traps, though often to the point of Redmane’s resistance. Opposite Cinderbrow is Marla Durand, who vocally opposes the lethality of the mechanisms.

boardgame.name: Greybanner Arena, Part 1: Arena Activities
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Greybanner’s geographical and cultural center is the Greybanner Arena. It stands above the surrounding houses and buildings, visible from miles across the rolling plains. The sight of it rising on the horizon sends a jolt through the bodies of any approaching fighters. The Arena is a place for them to make their name. It gathers crowds in the shared excitement of festivals and tournaments, filling its stands with uproarious praise for anyone brave enough to enter the ring. The dangers one might face within the Arena are unlike anything they might normally find, but so are the opportunities.

boardgame.name: Greybanner Arena, Part 2: The Grand Tournament
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

The pinnacle of Greybanner’s traditions is its Grand Tournament. Occurring once every ten years, the Tournament is a chance for fighters of all kinds to test themselves against their peers. Victors of the decade’s other competitions return alongside new entrants in the pursuit of being named the single Grand Champion. Gold and renown await whoever succeeds. But doing so will be far from easy. Any adventurer looking to participate will find themselves facing fighters of all experience levels and all with the determination to win.

As an extension to our coverage of the Greybanner Arena, we now cover the Grand Tournament. This event is the central draw to the Arena during the adventure. It is the core around which other events and adventures orbit, as well as a persistent activity for the characters to take part in. But to run a Tournament, you need fighters. That is why we’ve tortured ourselves by developing a full roster of 35 entrants and 2 returning Champions. With them, you can confidently run a Tournament full of believable, varied warriors for your characters to face. And perhaps one of the characters may even emerge as the Grand Champion?

boardgame.name: Gone Shockingly Awry: Lightning Elemental Encounter for 5e
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

An encounter with a supercharged elemental designed for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition. Battle maps and stat blocks included!

An experiment has gone terribly wrong and a being of pure energy now wreaks havoc within a wizard’s tower. Nearby townsfolk want to know what is happening. The wizard himself is desperate for assistance.

boardgame.name: House of Hidden Hunger: Mimic Encounter for 5e
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

A legion of mimics has grown large enough to replace the house they had infested. They have already consumed the owner, his dog, and a group of local delinquents, but their hunger is far from sated.

This encounter and its many creatures are a creative way to use our new Modular Rooftop Assets: as tokens! Players won’t suspect the difference until it’s too late…

boardgame.name: The Frigid Feeding Grounds: Winter Encounter for 5e
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

A cabin in the snowy wilds was once a rest stop for travelers but has recently become infested with icy undead. They use it to draw in prey and feast on frozen bodies.

The tundra claims many victims. Scything cold fills vast plains of white wasteland, pierced by mountains and forests. The elements dig beneath armor to drain travelers of their strength. Bones ache and muscles stiffen. But worse than all of that are the creatures that call the tundra home. Twisted by their environment, they share its unfeeling nature with the addition of bloodthirsty hunger.

boardgame.name: Hunter at the Nexus of Realms
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

An encounter inspired by Norse cosmology. A mysterious man and his wolf companions guard a magical secret in the heart of the woodlands…

A legend is told in the towns at the mountain’s feet. Every person and every village tell it with unique embellishment, but the core remains the same. They speak of a ritual site, hidden away in the forest and protected by an ageless guardian: Ulfganga, the Hunter Across Realms.

boardgame.name: Encounter with the Wildfire Elemental
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

The flames coalesce into the form of an elemental unlike any other you have seen or read about. They do not swirl in a loosely humanoid torrent or crackle and dance like a campfire. Instead, the fire focuses into a dense mass of pure, volatile energy. It takes shape, violent expulsions of fire binding into the forms of arms, and a vicious, chaotic face appearing above its core. The center is almost solid, like a tornado of burning, spitting plasma.

Around this form, you see the air itself quiver and burn. Waves of heat wash outwards, catching alight anything that is remotely flammable. Showers of embers spread flames below its every step. Sweat beads across your body. Even at this distance, you feel that moisture singe your skin, almost evaporating in the heat that caused it.

boardgame.name: Pod-X: Tracking Card
boardgame.description: Oversized reference card. You can use coins to track and cover any win conditions that have already been eliminated. It's the size of a postcard (6" x 4" )so it doesn't fit in the wallet, but is still VERY portable.

boardgame.name: Forever Home Animal Rescue Game
boardgame.description:
It’s FUR, FEATHERS, SCALES, and TAILS when you play Forever Home, the Animal Rescue Game! It’s a game of matching and collecting pets with their favorite things so you can adopt each type of house pet into its Forever Home. Collect your pets and supplies and freeze other players by blocking them with hazards like a tipped over food bowl, a lost ball, or an open bird cage. Find a new Supply Card to remedy the trouble and keep adopting those pets until you collect a whole loveable Pet Set! Find a wild card like Love Card, a Unicorn, or an Adoption Certificate to jump ahead of the other players!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Eye Karamba
boardgame.description:
A new character, Eye Karamba, for SuperP.L.E.X.!

A caped, 4-armed creature with a chained eyeball for a head.


Released in the April 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

boardgame.name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Tag Team Mode Bonus Pack
boardgame.description:
Six additional cards for SuperP.L.E.X. to play longer or 4P games. With one base game and a tag team bonus pack, 2 players can play an intense head-to-head Tag Team game. If players have two sets of the game then they can use the bonus pack to play up to 4 players.

Includes 2 new characters for Tag Team action:

Volcanessa
C'Food Lou


The bonus pack also includes their finishing moves and 2 tag cards to switch wrestlers.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

boardgame.name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Nerdman
boardgame.description:
A 2-card set promo featuring a new character, Nerdman.

Nerdman is based on designer Ryan Cowler's actual wrestling character, P.O.N.G. Ryan is part of Oakland, CA's Hoodslam league.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

boardgame.name: Drawings Part One
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pirates, princesses, processions. An art zine, inspired by the SEA.

Guns. Knives. Ships. Textiles. Magic. Gods.

Welcome to the Thousand Thousand Islands — a porous, patchwork reality inspired by Southeast Asia.

Drawings is an art zine. 30 detailed black-and-white illustrations, comprising character studies, action shots, and tableaux.

Dashing warriors; shrines and trade stalls; pirates, princesses, and magicians.

These images are the result of the artist’s initial research forays into the material cultures, lived stories, and mythistories of Southeast Asia. An appendix to A Thousand Thousand Islands.

boardgame.name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Cage Match Ring Playmat
boardgame.description:
A huge playmat that will make your table presence 100% more awesome.

The playmat also includes a unique Cage Match Ring that deals damage to characters that are pushed beyond the turnbuckle spaces.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

boardgame.name: Drawings Part Two
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sea battles, spirit masks, centaurs. An art zine, inspired by the SEA.

Ships. Masks. Shamans. Markets. Spirits.

Welcome to the Thousand Thousand Islands — a porous, patchwork reality inspired by Southeast Asia.

Drawings Part Two is an art zine. 44 pages of detailed black-and-white illustrations. Character studies of masked dancers and orangutan-men, action shots of ships at sea, tableaux of daily life.

Accompanied by texts and sketches detailing the use and context of three facets of pre-modern Southeast-Asian life: the finger knife; the fire piston; and the practice of betel-chewing.

This zine is the result of the artist’s continued research into the material cultures, lived realities, and mythistories of Southeast Asia. An appendix to A Thousand Thousand Islands.

boardgame.name: Vehicle Powers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vehicle Powers put a Hero behind the wheel, allowing them to embrace their inner speed demon and take command of a mean machine! From the hell-fuelled engines of demonic bikers to the high stakes’ feats performed by a family of street racers, Vehicle Powers imbue machines with amazing abilities and grant Hero’s the skills to drive them with maximum efficiency.

This sourcebook contains:

Expanded Vehicle Descriptors and Vehicle Features
Offensive Powers: King of the Road and Road Killer
Defensive Powers: Defensive Driver, Magic Mechanic, Ride Eternal and two more powers
Movement Powers:Crossroader, Ghost Engine, Vertical Drive and five more powers
Utility Powers: Buttons Galore! Reaction Time and Summon Ride
Other Powers: Shiny & Chrome and Vehicle Form
War Complications: Jalopy, Gear Nut Speed Freak and two more complications

boardgame.name: Iron and Fire
boardgame.description:
Iron and Fire is a moderate level complexity game covering the battles fought by the Peruvian Ironclad Huáscar during the 1879 War of the Pacific against Chile. It outclassed everything it met but there was only one (think of the SF classic, Ogre, but on the waters this time).

The Peruvian navy owns an ironclad monitor that outclasses everything else afloat in South America. But can it win a war by itself? Look at the 1879 "War of the Pacific", between Chile and Peru, which displayed naval technology one notch above the American Civil War.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Attack on the Damascus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the team is hired to storm the deck of a stolen spaceship, they encounter not only the terrorists who hijacked the vessel, but also a uniquely dangerous cargo their employer wishes to keep hidden.

Attack on the Damascus is a One-Sheet Scenario designed for use with Shadows Over Sol: Science Fiction Horror Roleplaying.

boardgame.name: First Strike!
boardgame.description:
First Strike looks at, well, the "first strike" by British airplanes. On Christmas Day, 1914, float planes were brought near land by the earliest "seaplane tenders" and turned loose on an "air reconnaissance" by planes which just happened to be carrying bombs and looking for Zeppelin sheds. There was also hope of luring out the German fleet, and an unexpected result of having the British naval force attacked by German airplanes.

Who would guess the very first "carrier-based air attack" would happen on Christmas Day, 1914? Yes, it happened! British seaplane tenders supported a "reconnaissance" against the German naval base at Cuxhaven . . . carrying bombs in the hopes of destroying the Zeppelin sheds that were there also. The fleet was attacked by German seaplanes in turn, and a remarkable adventure ended with few casualties on either side. It would make a great movie, but for now, it's a great game!

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Under Ten Flags: Hunting the Raider Atlantis 1939-1941
boardgame.description:
Under Ten Flags starts early in 1939 when the German merchant raider Atlantis made its way into the South Atlantic to sink and capture Allied cargo vessels. Its crew used their skill in disguising the appearance of the vessel to aid its encounters or avoid enemy warships. The journey of the raider Atlantis lasted for over 600 days and traveled over 100,000 miles.

Follows the 100,000 mile journey of the German "auxiliary cruiser" Atlantis, a "merchant raider" capable of changing its shaped and configuration as well as its flags. Atlantis is probably the most successful merchant raider of all times when combining total tonnage sunk and how long it forced the Royal Navy to chase it; plus, it captured documents of strategic importance that actually impacted the war. The "adventure" sounds like something from a movie, and in fact, did inspire one from which our title comes. Each player is challenged to "do better" than their historical counterparts.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Hitcat
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Hitcat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club January 2016 package.

January 2016 games were inspired by Pulp Fiction. This should add a little cult film twist to Wild Cats.


RULES
You MAY lie.
The player you vote for is eliminated. This may cause multiple eliminations and multiple winners. You tie for the win if only one player is eliminated.

boardgame.name: XXI: The Naval Wonder Weapon 1943-1945
boardgame.description:
XXI, a solitaire game set in 1943 that challenges the player (acting as both Speer and Dönitz) to organize and complete construction of a fleet (or at least “enough”) of the new German Type XXI submarine. However this new sub is far larger, more complex and more expensive, and requires much more manpower and scarce resources than previous submarines. Just a few of these new Type XXIs will do nothing. Only a radical transformation in shipbuilding techniques to mass produce the design - and not giving in to setbacks - will enable this “wonder weapon” to arrive in time....

The advanced Type XXI U-boat has the technology needed to survive and thrive in the Allied-controlled seas, and is a potential game-changer to the war's outcome . . . if it can be supplied in sufficient numbers in time. (In reality, only two went to war.) This is your challenge as a player, operating functionally as both the Naval Commander-in-Chief and Armaments Minister, working to foster production and work around wartime setbacks.

-description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Dude Cat
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, The Dude Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club February 2016 package.

It breaks the rules of the game a little, but is thematic perfection. It's also a fun twist on the game when you can mess with people without any worries of messing up yourself.


RULES
You must LIE.
You're the Dude Cat, so you've already won.
Have some fun with it.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Scissorpaws
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Scissorpaws, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club March 2016 package.

Edward Scissorhands. This movie is extremely iconic due to the main character and the clashing 1950's household perfect that he is placed in. It's one of Tim Burton's most well known (and one of 2 Tim Burton films that made 2016's list).

This Wild Cats card has players point with scissors style fingers at one or two players at once. Fun stuff all around. The big bummer is that we can't see the actual scissorpaws that Marty created on the cat.


RULES
You must LIE.
You vote with two fingers. You can point to multiple players or to one player twice. Votes for you do not count.
You win if Bad Cat is eliminated.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Cat Pack
boardgame.description:
An Oceans 11 inspired Wild Cats card, the Cat Pack, that allows a player to look at and redistribute the roles as they'd like, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club April 2016 package.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
IMMEDIATELY REVEAL YOURSELF.
Gather all roles, look, & redistribute as you like. Declare a partner role without revealing the player. You tie for the win if your partner wins.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Loompa Cat
boardgame.description:
A Wonka inspired Wild Cats card, the Loompa Cat that forces a player to rhyme and get rid of any bad eggs, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club May 2016 package.


RULES
You must tell the TRUTH.
The last word of all of your questions must rhyme.
You tie for the win if Bad Cat is eliminated.

boardgame.name: Bussin' Around
boardgame.description: 2-4 Bus Drivers go head to head in a take-that, pattern-matching, strategy card game about public transportation. Get the most paying customers on and off your bus before the end of the line!

boardgame.name: Cow, Tiger, Santa Claus: Alternate Play Rules – Co-op
boardgame.description:
A Board Game of the Month Club promo for January 2017 was a new Cooperative Alternate Play Rule set for Cow, Tiger, Santa Claus.

While it's winter-ish here in New Jersey, we still have plenty of long car rides. And instead of everyone fighting, we're going to work together and try to find some tough items (unless you pull the Santa Claus card in the next two weeks, that is).

This new rules card lets players join together and look for items as a group. More eyes should mean more points, but every 15 minutes you need to remove a card from play. When you find an item, it is scored and can not be scored again. As a reward, you may take a card that was removed from play back, and restart your 15 minute timer.

boardgame.name: X-tra INNINGS
boardgame.description:
The ultimate game of chance

A baseball fan’s game of choice

Game ncludes: Gameboard, player pieces, 1 set of die and score sheets (sample game included) with instructions

Ages 10 to adult for 1, 2 or more players

boardgame.name: Stroganov
Sztroganov
極東之旅-斯特羅加諾夫家族的遠征
스트로가노프
boardgame.description:
In the 16th century, Russia began to expand eastwards to develop the vast expanses of Siberia. This phase in history is closely associated with the name "Stroganov".

In the game Stroganov, players try to collect the best furs to gain wealth and fame as they move across the vastness that is Siberia. They will journey through Siberia in spring, summer, and autumn before returning home each winter. After four years (rounds), the player who has best utilized their actions and collected the most victory points wins.

Each year, the players must move eastward across the landscape. They can spend horses if they wish to travel further. Once they have advanced, they may take a basic action, such as trading or collecting furs or coins. Lastly, they may take more advanced actions such as visiting a village, setting up a yurt, taking a Tsar's wish (card), setting up a hunting lodge, or buying a landscape field. All of these actions — combined with exploring and some storytelling along the way — earn players victory points at the end of the game.

Every winter, players return home to Tyumen to prepare for a new year.

After four years, the game ends, then players score victory points based on having collected the right landscape tiles, fulfilled the Tsar's wishes, built hunting lodges, collected furs, and more.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Alley Cat
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Alley Cat, a charity card with all proceeds going to the Animal Welfare Association.


RULES
You must tell the TRUTH and LIE.
You win if you are eliminated.

boardgame.name: Nautilùs
boardgame.description:
Nautilùs illustrates an old sailor game from the 18th century, which was popular to play amongst sailors during the crossings of the pacific. The game combines old myths and yarns of the sea.

The goal of Nautilùs is to bring 4 sailors, illustrated by marbles, from the vortex in 60 steps to the safe harbor. Inspired by the game concepts from "Mensch Ärger dich nicht", "Tac" and "Dog", the game is being played in teams(2 against 2). During the ride, the sailors have to face several threats and challenges such as wrong compasses, pirate trips and the legendary white whale Moby Dick. Moby Dick is powerful and merciless - protect yourself from him in a cave in order to reach the save Harbor!

No matter if it´s storm or sunshine - Nautilùs is a must on your next navy!

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Office Cat
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Office Cat, inspired in Office Space, and delivered in Board Game of the Month Club June 2016 package.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or Lie.
You can quit. If you do, you tie for the win. If you stay and are eliminated, you are the only winner.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Horror Cat
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Horror Cat, inspired in Dr. Frank-N-Furter from The Rocky Horror Picture Show, and delivered in Board Game of the Month Club July 2016 package.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or Lie.
Before the vote, reveal yourself and ask a non-player to also vote. If you both vote the same, you tie for the win.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Baseball Furry
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Baseball Furry, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club August 2016 package.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you vote alone, your vote doesn't count. If you vote with majority, you tie for the win.

boardgame.name: Silver: Prince Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
A promo for Silver from Bezier Games. This was available as a part of the Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter campaign.

The card has a value of 3 and says, "When faceup: Your faceup cards are protected from opponents."

If you have a Prince faceup in your village, other players may not remove, flip, or modify any of your faceup village cards in any way.

Other players may give you additional faceup cards, as long as they are not required to switch for an existing faceup card in your village.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Tabby Wiseau
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Tabby Wiseau, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club September 2016 package, inspired on the cult film The Room.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
You must vote for yourself.
You win if somebody else also votes for you.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Rabbit Cat
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Rabbit Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club October 2016 package, inspired on the cult film Donnie Darko.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
You do not vote. Reveal yourself after the vote. Count to three and players vote again. If the eliminated player changes, you tie for the win.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Drummer Cat
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Drummer Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club November 2016 package, inspired on the cult film This Is Spinal Tap.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you were eliminited last game, you are immediately eliminated.
You tie for the win if you are not eliminated.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Lydia Catz
boardgame.description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Lydia Catz, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club December 2016 package, inspired on the cult film Beetlejuice.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you ask the same question three times without anyone identifying you, the game ends immediately and you win.
Otherwise, you do not vote.

boardgame.name: Infinity Defiance: Outcast
boardgame.description:
First Infinity Defiance expansion!

The characters of the Defiance, on who’s shoulders rest the fate of the Human Sphere. Named heroes even before they jumped to the far side of the ​Acheron ​wormhole. Are now considered outlawed.

Marked as infected, and compromised by the insidious Shasvastii and their dangerous Specular Killers. However, even when branded as traitors the crew of the Defiance will do their best to survive.

With the help of Ensign Katherine Cho of O-12, who does not believe the official propaganda of her superiors. Also with mercenary operator Raoul Spector, who has previously worked with Katherine while undercover.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wonky Words
boardgame.description:
Wonky Words is a Scrabble-like word game where you form words inside polyomino word holders before placing them.

Grab a shape, insert letters, play your word(s).

No individual turns. Simultaneous game play for fast action.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Infinity Defiance: Revenant
boardgame.description:
Years after returning from the other side of the Wormhole of Acheron and cleaning out their files, the crew members of the Defiance and a motley crew of collaborators – including Kendriat, an impetuous Morat, and Jaan Staar, a Tohaa with unsettling abilities - serve as freelance agents and soldiers of fortune under the banner of their own mercenary company: The Revenant Mobile Intervention Force.

The MIF owes its name to the Revenant, the current moniker for the old and famous space daring vessel - The Defiance, which was the first human ship to ever reach Combined Army space and return to tell the tale.

boardgame.name: Aristotle's Elements and Space
boardgame.description:
Aristotle’s Elements and Space is a Greek themed, interactive card game that is fun for the whole family and sure to keep you on your toes. Lay down your cards featuring Ancient Greek philosophers, mathematicians, and gods and compete with your friends to see which element will triumph. Best for 3-5 players ages 10+, it only takes 10 minutes to learn and 15 minutes to play. Choose your cards carefully, call an element of surprise when you’re feeling lucky, and watch out that no one steals your tokens: Open up a box of fun and battle to reign victorious over the table.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Strain Series: ZOMBV
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The living dead are a nightmare that is deeply ingrained into the human psyche. From alien parasites, to black magic, to engineered viral infections, Outbreak: Undead.. allows you to experience a survival horror sandbox of your own design. ZOMBV, the first entry of the Strain Series, is a world book exploring the Zombic virus, with you and your friends at the center of the story.

Presenting a brand new setting for Outbreak: Undead... 2nd Edition! Take the work out of world design and get focused on the personal stories that make up the heart and soul of your Zombie Survival Simulation.

boardgame.name: Urban Shadows Quickstart
Urban Shadows Second Edition Quickstart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The City Hungers. Will You Feed It?

The streets bleed shadows as the supernatural politics of the city threaten to swallow you whole. Will you die a hero—a savior for those who have never had enough—or live long enough to become the villain? Will you fight the darkness...or give in for power?

The choice is yours.

Urban Shadows: Second Edition is an urban fantasy tabletop roleplaying game in which mortals and monsters vie for control of a modern-day city, a political battleground layered just under the reality we think we know. Vampires, faeries, hunters, and wizards fight to carve out a piece of the streets and skyscrapers, ready to make deals with all those who have something to offer.

Urban Shadows: Second Edition is based on the Powered by the Apocalypse framework, with all new rules designed to help you play a game of political urban fantasy. This quickstart includes everything you need to play a few sessions of the game, such as:

Basic moves and rules to play
Six archetype playbooks
Special rules for Debts and Circles
New faction turn rules for 2E
Complete systems for intimacy and harm

boardgame.name: Wild Tile Variant Kit for the Game of ACQUIRE
boardgame.description:
The ACQUIRE Wild Tile Variant Kit is made to fit most editions of ACQUIRE games. This kit allows each player to start with a blank tile that can be played on any open square during their turn at any time during the game.

The ACQUIRE Wild Tile Kit includes six (6) blank tiles and an instruction booklet. Tiles are from actual ACQUIRE games that have been painted to hide the designations. The instruction booklet is printed on yellow card stock for maximum durability and readability.

The Wild Tile Variant allows each player to start the game with that one "key" tile that they may need at one point in the game. It increases the ability to create mergers and helps to alleviate frustration when a player has nothing but "bad" tiles and is unable to maintain a foothold in the game. Some games, with the luck of the draw, a player may never need their Wild Tile.

Included with this Wild Tile Kit are Lloyd's Rules of ACQUIRE, which were designed to help eliminate the one-sided games that can occur during the regular game play in ACQUIRE.

(The Wild Tile Variant is an idea conceived by Allan Wright)

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Holden
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Catcher in the Rye by J. D. Salinger, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club January 2018 package.

Holden:
(1) Curses: Advance any Progress Token one space and stall that Power.
(3) Foils: Bump all Progress and Power Tokens on one card to the end of their line.

boardgame.name: Shiver Quick-Start Guide
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to SHIVER, a roleplaying game all about storytelling in worlds of horror and mystery. In SHIVER some players will take on the role of a classic Archetype, exploring the story as it unfolds. Whether that be escaping the clutches of a relentless killer as a group of hapless teens, monster hunters delving into ancient crypts, or exploring an alien planet with hungry inhabitants, the choice is up to you.

This quick-start guide will provide you with all the information you need to pick a character Archetype that’s right for you and provide a brief overview of how to play the game. Some rules and the process of character creation have been condensed to get you playing quickly.

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Celie
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Color Purple by Alice Walker, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club March 2018 package.

Celie:
(1) Independence: Move any Power token back 1 space.
(2) Rebirth: If at only 1 Stamina, reset to starting Stamina (*).

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Alice
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Go Ask Alice by Beatrice Sparks, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club April 2018 package.

Alice:
(2) Express: Reorder the action cards as you would like.
(3) Escape: Eliminate a Power card from the game. (once per game)

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Huck
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn by Mark Twain, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club May 2018 package.

Huck:
(1) Accept: Roll a die and move your Stamina to that number.
(3) Deceive: Reverse the lanes to be ordered as 3, 2, 1.

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Jerry
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Chocolate War by Robert Cormier, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club June 2018 package.

Jerry:
(1) Refuse: Do not flip actions face-down this turn.
(2) Showdown: Roll a die, if the result matches a Power's track, reduce the Power to 1. (can impact multiple Powers)

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Old Major
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Animal Farm by George Orwell, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club July 2018 package.

Old Major:
(1) Inspire: Shuffle and re-deal the action cards.
(2) Revolt: Skip the Powers this turn.

boardgame.name: Zine Game
boardgame.description:
Will your zines be the best ones on the shelf? Will you be caught stealing copies?

In Zine Game, players earn points based on supplies, durable bindings, and other issues that zine publishers struggle with. Will you have the next great idea — or will your rivals destroy your hard work before it ever sees the light of day?

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Tango
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from And Tango Makes Three by Justin Richardson & Peter Parnell, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Clu December 2018 package.

Tango:
(3) Warmth: Use any or all of the face up action cards in any order that you would like. Do not flip or re-order them after using them.

boardgame.name: Festival of Madness
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

An Unearthed Prophecy, Corruption In The Trade Council, and The Return of an Old Foe...

The heroes become aware of an age old prophecy which seems to be describing them. Not everyone wishes this prophecy to be fulfilled however, and soon they are dodging attempts upon their lives as they race to discover what it all means.

Divine Visitations, religious politics, cultist lairs, betrayal and worse await the heroes as they pursue their destiny until the bitter end.

Festival of Madness is a scenario for heroic rank characters and is the third and final installment of the Songs of Regret Plot Point Campaign.

...This Could Change Everything In The Sundered Skies.

boardgame.name: Space Travel Dice
boardgame.description:
“Space Travel Dice: The storytelling game with nine wooden dice.”

“Revive the art of storytelling using these nine illustrated wooden dice to create intergalactic adventures. Includes superhuman powers that will make your heroes utterly invincible! Ideal for playing by a log fire, this game will stimulate the imaginations of children and adults alike.”

Rules:
Any number of players.
Roll all eight of the mainly black-sided dice. Begin telling a story based on the images you rolled. Save the the red-sided die for later rolling and use. Each of the eight mainly black-sided dice have one red ‘@‘ symbol. This allows you to roll the red die and get a super power based on what you roll. You can get multiple powers in a story and the build.

You can try telling the story in single die roll sequence or create the story collaboratively by taking turns rolling and adding to the story.

boardgame.name: Duell der Sterneköche
boardgame.description:
Who is the best cook on board? Will you be faster than your colleagues in providing the crew with tasty food? All without wasting precious ingredients?

Card game with Set collection.

boardgame.name: Hexodius
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A unique twist on twin-stick shooters, Hexodius uses a hex grid to explore, choosing when you want to fight, or upgrade your drone. Once in the actual fight it is a familiar Twin-Stick shooter, but first it takes strategy to choose your fights.

boardgame.name: Go monkey go
boardgame.description:
Crazy climbing action game.
Wanna get funky?
Do the monkey!
Race your monkey up the tree!
Dump all your marbles into the trunk to win!

Every player starts with 5 coconuts, the first player to run out of coconuts wins. Use the ropes to make your monkey climb the palm tree and pour a coconut on top of the palm tree, the cononut will fall into a player tray at ramdom.

boardgame.name: Rock Zombie
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A modern take on classic beat'em ups, you play as one of three female rock band members fending off zombies with the power of music.

boardgame.name: Too Many Stars
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You were in the sky when it started, in ships among the stars. The threat came suddenly, and the response was clear - leave, now. You left without saying goodbye, without looking back. Now, you and your fellow pilots returned to circle the planet you once called home, and something went wrong. And now you’re stranded. The threat remains, and the few groups of survivors who remain are either suspicious of your arrival or angry at your departure. So that just leaves you, your crew, and the ruined wasteland of somewhere that used to be home.

boardgame.name: Redline
boardgame.description:
An action game that made its name for being able to get in and out of vehicles while being a first-person shooter. Fairly groundbreaking for its time.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Redline_%281999_video_game%29 Redline (1999 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: No Heroes Allowed!
boardgame.description:
In the third release in the What Did I Do to Deserve this my lord series, this entry follows up from the previous games, this time adding water, and aquatic monsters.

Also new is the addition of a mutliplayer mode requiring two copies of the game, and two psps.
boardgame.videogameseries: What Did I Do To Deserve This My Lord!?

boardgame.name: They Howl and Grow Claws
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This cabin is ours. This place is ours. And we are together. But this is the last time these things will be true.

We are a queer group of friends, newly graduated, who’ve decided to celebrate by taking one final trip together before we go our separate ways. One of us owns a cabin—or rather, their family owns a cabin—out in the woods, in the middle of nowhere. It’s not as lonely or boring as it might sound, because we’ve always gone together. We’ve been there more than once, and we’re going one last time.

We love this place. It’s our place.

boardgame.name: The Glass Dream Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Glass Dream Game gives us teachers and students, ivory towers and scars of war, ethics and politics, games and philosophy, catastrophe and the glint of a better world from an intellectual community, asking “What do you do next?”

The time of war and destruction has ended. It ended because the world rose up as one, then banded together to create an academy, meant to preserve our best lessons and teach us how to move forward. And then they moved on, and forgot.

Nations once again populate the map, industry is returning, and people continue to live as they always have, as best they can.

But we, the teachers and students, are still here, still studying, still learning, still building a better world. If we learn enough, could we finish what they started? Can we teach the world utopia? Can we learn it ourselves?

boardgame.name: Our Haunt
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You wake up in a home you don’t recognize. You feel cold. As you make your way around the home, inspecting its abandoned rooms and decaying interior, you realize you only feel the cold. You’re not hungry, tired, or anything, really. Just cold.

Someone comes in. “Hello? Anyone here?” they call out. You answer, but your voice sounds strange to you. You walk up to them, and they pointedly ignore you. You become angry (even the anger feels odd). Before you can say anything else, they walk right through you.

You look down at your hands. Really look at them. You can see through them, just barely. And now it’s fear, fear that doesn’t sit right in you. And you realize it’s because you no longer have a physical heart for the fear to grip on to.

That’s right. You died.

User summary:

Our Haunt is published in two PDF documents:


21-page game
13-page "kit" (print-and-play components)

boardgame.name: Tower of Doom
boardgame.description:
A great role-playing game for the Intellivision that, while not officially licensed as Dungeons & Dragons, was certainly inspired by it.

Tower of Doom allowed you to start off as one of many different classes, each with its own starting equipment. Some were easier, like the knight, while others were very difficult, like the waif. You also selected the quest you wanted to go on (choice of 7), which varied in difficulty/length.

A map was drawn out in real time as you explored, implementing a fog-of-war like mechanic. Monsters and items were displayed on the map, and when you encountered a monster it moved to a real-time combat screen where you could engage or retreat.

Your character didn't really "level up" per se as collect equipment that improved their combat abilities. You could also pick up potions, which typically had unknown effects the first time you tried them. Some were positiive and others were negative.

Overall not the most advanced graphics of the day, but an incredible RPG entry of the era with tons of replayability and lots of challenge.

boardgame.name: Dream Ablare
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A game set in the one world where belonging is always scarce: high school.

boardgame.name: Intellivision Greatest Hits 20th Anniversary Edition
boardgame.description: Contains 25 classic games from the Intellivision, fully emulated for the PC. Rare among other compilations, this version includes some of the talking Intellivision games.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Nightmares II: The Memory
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Nightmares II is a first-person psychological horror that takes you through a journey of discovering what nightmares are.

The game is inspired by classic roguelike games which include 100% procedural-generated maps and permadeath. These features play an important part in making this game tense with the feeling of dread & terror as you walk the hallways of the dungeon.

Every time you play, the dungeons are randomised which guarantees unlimited replay value.

The game is simple. Get through each dungeon by surviving the horrors that lurk deep within and making your way to the exit.

Source: The Developer Website.
